Pepto-Bismol is the brand name of bismuth subsalicylate, which is used to treat several stomach conditions, including diarrhea, gas, heartburn (acid reflux/GERD), nausea, and stomach discomfort. Pepto-Bismol belongs to a class of drugs called antidiarrheals, which are used to relieve diarrhea and related symptoms. However, Pepto-Bismol can be given to dogs to treat diarrhea and stomach discomfort. Bismuth subsalicylate, sold under the brand name Pepto-Bismol, is a medication used to treat temporary discomforts of the stomach and gastrointestinal tract, such as diarrhea, indigestion, heartburn and nausea. Commonly known as pink bismuth, it is also sometimes the active ingredient in Kaopectate. It has the empirical chemical formula of C 7 H 5 BiO 4, is a colloidal substance obtained by hydrolysis of bismuth salicylate (Bi{C 6 H 4 (OH)CO 2 } 3).

Pepto-Bismol (bismuth subsalicylate) belongs to a class of medications called anti-diarrheal agents. As the name suggests, Pepto-Bismol is used to treat diarrhea, or loose, watery stools. The medicine in Pepto-Bismol helps to relieve diarrhea by reducing the flow of fluids and other substances into the intestines. It may also destroy organisms that promote diarrhea. Pepto-Bismol may also help to relieve other gastrointestinal problems, including heartburn, upset stomach and nausea.
